entry.title: Thank you, Representative Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez, HD4, for...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Thank you, Representative Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez, HD4, for continuing the fight for youth voter access and urging Coloradans to #VoteNoOn76.

entry.title: Reminder: You can always rely on the Secretary of State's...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Reminder: You can always rely on the Secretary of State's website for accurate info on voting, registering to vote, and election results. For more info visit www.GoVoteColorado.gov.

Colorado Secretary of State's Office

Secretary of State Jena Griswold: To combat foreign interference, we are launching a new initiative reminding Coloradans that “opinions are fun, but facts are b...etter.” When it comes to election information, visit www.GoVoteColorado.gov for reliable information on registering, voting, and election results. #TrustedInfo2020 #FactsareBetter https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/2020/PR20201020Misinformation…

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: “Tens of thousands of newly eligible young voters eager to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

“Tens of thousands of newly eligible young voters eager to participate in our democracy would be disenfranchised each primary season by Amendment 76.”

When young people are engaged in our democracy we all win. Stop youth voter suppression. Vote NO on 76!

32 State Lawmakers Condemn 76 as an Anti-immigrant “Voter Suppression” Effort, Urge no Vote DENVER – In a letter released Monday, 32 Democratic state lawmakers called on Coloradans to vote no on Amendment 76, condemning the measure as a “cynical, … Continue reading →

aclu-co.org

Colorado Legislators Sign Joint Letter Opposing Amendment 76 | ACLU of Colorado

entry.title: You have a right to cast your ballot free from intimidation....
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

You have a right to cast your ballot free from intimidation. Know your rights and how to report violations:

Within 100 feet of a building in which a VSPC or ballot drop box is located, you have the right to vote or wait without anyone trying to influence your vote.

If you witness someone trying to influence votes within 100 feet of these locations, please call the toll free Election Protection hotline:

...

1 866 OUR VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or the Spanish language hotline 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682). Email us at: voting@aclu-co.org.

If you do not speak English, you have the right to receive assistance from someone who speaks your language and English.

For more info and guidance on voter intimidation and disinformation, visit https://justvotecolorado.org/index.php/faqs/

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: Want to vote in-person? Colorado Voter Service & Polling...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Want to vote in-person? Colorado Voter Service & Polling Centers (VSPC) have opened today, and will stay open until November 3rd at 7 p.m. All in-person VSPC locations will follow public health guidelines to ensure that you, the voters, will be safe while casting your ballot. If you're heading over to a VSPC to vote, don't forget to bring identification since it is required to vote in person.

To find a VSPC near you, go to: https://www.sos.state.co.us/pubs/elections/VIP.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: If you do not have a fixed permanent home, you are still...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If you do not have a fixed permanent home, you are still eligible to register to vote and cast a ballot. Voting in person is also an option for you if your mail in ballot is not accessible. For more info on voting without a permanent address, visit: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/F…/foreclosureHomelessFAQ.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: From South Fork to Crested Butte to Lyons and beyond, Black...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

From South Fork to Crested Butte to Lyons and beyond, Black Lives Matter. It's up to all of us to "make the change and be the change ourselves." For more on our action on behalf of Sol Mountain Farm go to https://dpo.st/2HkzFfi

While big cities have dominated the headlines this summer with massive rallies, large-scale tumult and legislative reforms to address police brutality and racial injustice, small communities in Col…

denverpost.com

entry.title: We support secure, inclusive and accurate voting as a foundation...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

We support secure, inclusive and accurate voting as a foundation of the democratic process. Colorado leads the country in voter access and election security and has ensured that the outcome of this election is accurate. Vote Colorado proud. #OurVoteOurFight

entry.title: The Colorado Secretary of State’s Office is offering...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The Colorado Secretary of State’s Office is offering BallotTrax, a ballot tracking and messaging system available to all counties.

Voters will receive a notification that they have been enrolled in the service if their registration record contains an email address. If you don’t receive an auto-enrollment notification, you can sign up at https://colorado.ballottrax.net.

For more info on tracking your ballot, visit https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/2020/PR20200914BallotTracking…

entry.title: Colorado has used ballot drop box locations for over 6 years and...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado has used ballot drop box locations for over 6 years and offers hundreds of secure locations that are monitored 24/7. Avoid lines and accommodate your busy schedule by returning your ballot to a drop box today.

Find your nearest drop box at: https://justvotecolorado.org/

entry.title: We demand trans justice and Colorado will vote like it. Tell us...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

We demand trans justice and Colorado will vote like it. Tell us what you’re voting for. #OurVoteOurFight www.aclu.org/ourvoteourfight
